com.b2international.index

Enum Analyzers

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Analyzers>
      • com.b2international.index.Analyzers
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Analyzers>

    public enum Analyzers
extends java.lang.Enum<Analyzers>
    Supported analyzers are listed here. Use with Text annotation on String fields.
    Since:
    5.0

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CASE_SENSITIVE
      "case_sensitive": { "tokenizer" : "whitespace", "filter" : [ "possessive", "word_splitter", "unique_token" ] }
      CASE_SENSITIVE_ASCII
      "case_sensitive_ascii_folding": { "tokenizer" : "whitespace", "filter" : [ "asciifolding", "possessive", "word_splitter", "unique_token" ] }
      CASE_SENSITIVE_ASCII_EXACT
      "case_sensitive_ascii_folding_exact_match": { "tokenizer" : "keyword", "filter" : [ "asciifolding" ] }
      CASE_SENSITIVE_PREFIX
      "case_sensitive_prefix": { "tokenizer": "whitespace", "filter": [ "asciifolding", "possessive", "word_splitter", "unique_token", "edge_ngram" ] }
      DEFAULT
      The default term analyzer, by default escapes all whitespaces and any character from the default delimiters list and includes a leading and trailing marker from the Unicode Private Use Area characters to mark the beginning and end of a text.
      EXACT
      Indexes the term as is for exact match searches with ASCII folding and in lower-case form.
      INDEX
      Use the same analyzer that is configured for the Analyzed#analyzer() field.
      PREFIX
      "prefix": { "tokenizer": "whitespace", "filter": [ "asciifolding", "lowercase", "possessive", "word_splitter", "unique_token", "edge_ngram" ] }
      SEARCH_STEMMING
      "search_stemming": { "tokenizer" : "whitespace", "filter" : [ "asciifolding", "lowercase", "possessive", "unique_token", "english_stemmer" ] }
      STEMMING
      "stemming": { "tokenizer" : "whitespace", "filter" : [ "asciifolding", "lowercase", "possessive", "word_splitter", "unique_token", "english_stemmer" ] }
      TOKENIZED
      "tokenized": { "tokenizer": "whitespace", "filter": [ "asciifolding", "lowercase", "possessive", "word_splitter", "unique_token" ] } "word_splitter": { "type": "word_delimiter", "split_on_case_change": "false", "preserve_original": "true", "stem_english_possessive": "false", "type_table": [", => DIGIT", ".

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • DEFAULT

        public static final Analyzers DEFAULT
        The default term analyzer, by default escapes all whitespaces and any character from the default delimiters list and includes a leading and trailing marker from the Unicode Private Use Area characters to mark the beginning and end of a text.

      • EXACT

        public static final Analyzers EXACT
        Indexes the term as is for exact match searches with ASCII folding and in lower-case form. "exact_match": { "tokenizer": "keyword", "filter": [ "asciifolding", "lowercase" ] }

      • TOKENIZED

        public static final Analyzers TOKENIZED
        "tokenized": { "tokenizer": "whitespace", "filter": [ "asciifolding", "lowercase", "possessive", "word_splitter", "unique_token" ] } "word_splitter": { "type": "word_delimiter", "split_on_case_change": "false", "preserve_original": "true", "stem_english_possessive": "false", "type_table": [", => DIGIT", ". => DIGIT"] }

      • values

        public static Analyzers[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (Analyzers c : Analyzers.values())
    System.out.println(c);

        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared
